cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW on Monday and then NW Tuesday, curving NNE across the northeast Gulf toward Floridaâ€™s Big Bend, then tracking NE across GA/SC and moving offshore of the Carolinas by Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (likely Big Bend region)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then southeastern U.S. coastline from Georgia through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (7%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds (~39 mph) by late Friday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Wilmington based on current track and low intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain possible late Thursday night through Friday (generally <2 inches).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated squalls and rough seas may affect vessel operations as the system passes offshore.
